Mission.Author: KingRaptor
Mission.Description: An introduction to unit classes in Zero-K.
Mission.Name: Unit Classes Tutorial

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message
TriggerLogic.Message:
Now let's learn about the different \255\255\255\0\unit classes\008 in Zero-K.
Note that while the following descriptions will be broadly true of most or all unit types within a class, each unit has its own distinct traits that affect the way it is best used. Try them out in a skirmish or multiplayer game to learn their ins and outs.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
\255\255\255\0\Raiders\008 are fast and and do a lot of damage quickly, but have very low health. They are good against units with inaccurate weapons, such as skirmishers.
Kill the enemy units to continue.
TIP: Use attack move to have your raiders automatically attempt to evade enemy fire.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: \255\255\255\0\Riot\008 units excel at wiping out large numbers of small enemy units, such as raiders. They generally do a lot of damage quickly, but are slow and have modest health.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
\255\255\255\0\Skirmishers\008 have good range and are effective against slow, short-ranged units such as riots. They have relatively low health and damage output. Don't let them get into close combat.
TIP: Use attack move to have your skirms try to keep their distance ("kite" the enemy).

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: Some skirmishers can also destroy shorter-ranged enemy static defences from outside their range. Try it now.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: \255\255\255\0\Assault\008 units are tough and can brute-force enemy defences. Most have trouble hitting fast-moving units. Their speed is generally middling.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: \255\255\255\0\Artillery\008 units use their long range to destroy defence structures from afar. Typical artillery units have trouble hitting moving targets.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: \255\255\255\0\Anti\008-\255\255\255\0\aircraft\008 (AA) units can only hit planes and gunships but are the most cost-effective way of dealing with them. They generally have long range compared to anti-ground weapons.

That concludes the unit classes demonstration. Feel free to continue practicing with the different units.
Click Next to end.
